edu.umich.eecs.april.tag

Class TagFamily

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umich.eecs.april.tag.TagFamily
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tag16h5, Tag25h7, Tag25h9, Tag36h10, Tag36h11, Tag36h9

    public class TagFamily
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic class for all tag encoding families.

    • Field Detail

      • whiteBorder

        public int whiteBorder
        How many pixels wide is the outer-most white border? This is only used when rendering a tag, not for decoding a tag (since we look for the white/black edge).

      • blackBorder

        public int blackBorder
        How many pixels wide is the inner black border?

      • bits

        public final int bits
        number of bits in the tag. Must be a square (n^2).

      • d

        public final int d
        dimension of tag. e.g. for 16 bits, d=4. Must be sqrt(bits).

      • minimumHammingDistance

        public final int minimumHammingDistance
        What is the minimum hamming distance between any two codes (accounting for rotational ambiguity? The code can recover (minHammingDistance-1)/2 bit errors.

      • errorRecoveryBits

        public int errorRecoveryBits
        The error recovery value determines our position on the ROC curve. We will report codes that are within errorRecoveryBits of a valid code. Small values mean greater rejection of bogus tags (but false negatives). Large values mean aggressive reporting of bad tags (but with a corresponding increase in false positives).

      • codes

        public final long[] codes
        The array of the codes. The id for a code is its index.

      • popCountTableShift

        static final int popCountTableShift
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • popCountTable

        static final byte[] popCountTable

    • Constructor Detail

      • TagFamily

        public TagFamily(int bits,
                 int minimumHammingDistance,
                 long[] codes)
        The codes array is not copied internally and so must not be modified externally.

    • Method Detail

      • setErrorRecoveryBits

        public void setErrorRecoveryBits(int b)
        Set the error recovery bits.

      • setErrorRecoveryFraction

        public void setErrorRecoveryFraction(double v)

      • rotate90

        public static long rotate90(long w,
                            int d)
        if the bits in w were arranged in a d*d grid and that grid was rotated, what would the new bits in w be? The bits are organized like this (for d = 3): 8 7 6 2 5 8 0 1 2 5 4 3 ==> 1 4 7 ==> 3 4 5 (rotate90 applied twice) 2 1 0 0 3 6 6 7 8

      • hammingDistance

        public static final int hammingDistance(long a,
                                        long b)
        Compute the hamming distance between two longs.

      • popCountReal

        static final int popCountReal(long w)
        How many bits are set in the long?

      • popCount

        public static final int popCount(long w)

      • decode

        public void decode(TagDetection det,
                   long rcode)
        Given an observed tag with code 'rcode', try to recover the id. The corresponding fields of TagDetection will be filled in.

      • getTagRenderDimension

        public int getTagRenderDimension()
        Return the dimension of the tag including borders when we render it.

      • makeImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage makeImage(int id)

      • writeAllImages

        public void writeAllImages(java.lang.String dirpath)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Generate all valid tags, writing them as PNGs in the specified directory. The files will be named tag##_##_####.png, where the first block is nbits, the second block is hamming distance, and the final block is the id.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAllImagesMosaic

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getAllImagesMosaic()
